column4: anyone know how to format the "virtual CD" drive in western digital external hard drives?
blast the first 512 bytes of the hard drive,  recreate the partion table,  and reformat it?
you'll lose any data but it'll wokr
dd if=/dev/zero of=/dev/EXTERNAL_HARDDRIVE_DEVICE bs=512 count=1   .. then repartition with cfdisk ..then format
i remember reading that "dd" can be dangerous, are you familiar with that?
if you don't care about any data on the drive..and are positive that you're pointing it at the right device it's not going to break anything.
basically you're writing zeros over the mbr and partition table..then you're creating a new partition table..then you're creating your filesystem
all data on drive will be lost
point DD at the wrong device and  you'll have a bad day
data won't be an issue as everything on it is about 5% of my internal HDD size so that won't be a problem. however, the Disk Utility in ubuntu doesn't see the virtual-CD as a partition
well it's either on th drive..or its another device built into the hard drive.
I'm not familiar with it.  Maybe they have some kind of flash device that shows up
in that case you're probably hosed unless you rip it apart and remove it :)
well, flash is rarely if ever Read-Only, right? :)
